thread.title: VARSITY ARTS: Redlands High actress to star in 'Macbeth'
thread.title_full: VARSITY ARTS: Redlands High actress to star in 'Macbeth' - Press Enterprise

author: AMY ZAHN
title: VARSITY ARTS: Redlands High actress to star in 'Macbeth'
text:
By AMY ZAHN / CONTRIBUTING WRITER
Published: Oct. 8, 2015 2:57 p.m. VARSITY ARTS: Redlands High actress to star in 'Macbeth' Print Photo Share Pin It More Galleries ADVERTISEMENT Redlands High school senior Madeline Wall, an aspiring theater star who recently moved from New York, will be taking on a lead role in her school’s production of the iconic play “Macbeth.” COURTESY OF MADELINE WALL Related article » "MACBETH" WHEN: 6 p.m. Oct. 14, 7 p.m. Oct. 15-17, and 2 p.m. on Oct. 17
WHERE: Clock Auditorium at Redlands High School, 840 E Citrus Ave., Redlands.
PRICE: $12 general admission; $10 senior citizens, ASB and faculty
INFORMATION: 909-307-5500, Ext. 30508
"ARCADIA" WHEN: 8 p.m. Nov. 6, 7, 13, 14, and 2 p.m. Nov. 7, 8, 14, 15
WHERE: The Box at the Fox Entertainment Plaza, 3635 Market St., Riverside
PRICE: $25 general admission
INFORMATION: gestalttheatreproject.com
Redlands High school senior Madeline Wall, an aspiring theater star who recently moved from New York, will be taking on a lead role in her school’s production of the iconic play “Macbeth.”
Madeline, who has been acting since the age of 10, explained that Shakespeare can be particularly difficult to perform, even for experienced actors.
“It’s challenging linguistically and it’s also difficult to envision yourself taking on a really iconic figure, which is what a lot of these characters are,” she said. Madeline will be playing Lady Macbeth, wife of the protagonist Lord Macbeth. “It just takes a lot of work and a lot of dedication and it’s cool to be exposed to that at my age.”
Madeline has appeared in several other productions, both in the community and at school, since moving from upstate New York last summer, including “Mary Poppins” and “The Last Days of Judas Iscariot.”
In addition to Macbeth, Madeline is currently working on a production of “Arcadia” with the Gestalt Theater Project.
She plans to explore all facets of theater as career options, including directing and writing in addition to acting. Madeline hopes to pursue these goals next year at a university in the midwest, possibly the University of Iowa or Minnesota.
While her passion for acting is manifold, she explained that getting inside a character’s head is what draws her in.
“It’s an opportunity to delve into a mind that may or may not be similar to your own, and it teaches you empathy and compassion and makes you a very self aware person,” she said. “That’s what I think interests me about it.”
Contact the writer: community@pe.com
